amendment.description: Amendment in the nature of a substitute sought to strengthen private property rights and PILT programs; address maintenance problems in public parks; and make funding discretionary for the first 5 years after enactment.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 26 printed in House Report 106-612 to strengthen private property rights and PILT programs; address public maintenance problems in public parks; and to make funding discretionary for the first 5 years that the bill is enacted.

action.text: Amendment (A024) in the nature of a substitute offered by Mr. Thornberry.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Thornberry amendment (A024) Failed by recorded vote: 126 - 291 (Roll no. 177).
